Ch. 804
   870.01   DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   "Taxicab operator" means and Includes every corporation, company,
association, joint stock association, person, firm or copartnership, its
licensees, lessees, receivers or trustees appointed by any court whatsoever,
owning, controlling, operating, maintaining or managing one or more taxicabs
within the City.
   (b)   "Taxicab" means and includes any motor-driven vehicle engaged in the
business of carrying passengers for hire or fare or offered for hire or fare to
the public for transportation, operating within the City, except motor buses
operated on regular schedules and over regularly established routes.
   (c)   "Taxicab driver" means any person who drives or operates a taxicab.
   (d)   "Street" means and includes any public street, alley and public way
within the corporate limits of the City.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.02   COMPLIANCE REQUIRED.
   No taxicab operator shall operate any taxicab for the transportation of
persons, for hire, on any street within the City, except in accordance with the
provisions of this chapter.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.03   TAXICAB OPERATOR'S LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No taxicab operator shall operate any taxicab business for the
transportation of persons within the City without first having obtained a
taxicab operator's license from the Mayor or other duly authorized issuing
authority, declaring that the public convenience and necessity require such
operation, as provided in this chapter.
   870.04   POWERS OF MAYOR RE TAXICAB OPERATORS.
   The Mayor is hereby authorized to:
   (a)   Require the filing of annual reports, schedules or rates of fare and
other data by all taxicab operators operating within the City, and that the
provisions of this chapter are carefully observed and fully carried out; and
   (b)   Prescribe rules and regulations and issue orders in conformity with
the provisions hereof applicable to any and all taxicab operators. No person
shall violate any such rule, regulation or order.
   870.05   TAXICAB OPERATORS' LICENSE APPLICATIONS.
   (a)   In addition to the requirements of Section 804.03, the taxicab
operator's license shall contain a description of the equipment to be used, the
number of taxicabs to be operated, a statement that the applicant, if granted a
license, will so operate its taxicab business as to be available for service to
the public at all hours, and such other facts as may be necessary.
   (b)   Such applications shall be signed and sworn to by the applicant and
filed as a permanent record in the office of the Chief of Police.
   870.06   HEARING BEFORE MAYOR.
   Whenever any applicant for a taxicab operator's license has complied with
all the conditions and regulations relating to the filing of his application,
the Mayor shall fix a date for the hearing of such application, which shall not
be less than thirty days from the date of filing, and forward a notice thereof
to Council at its next regular meeting. Notice of such hearing shall be given
to all persons interested, including the operators of all other taxicabs in the
City, at least five days before the date set for such hearing.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.07   MATTERS TO BE CONSIDERED.
   In determining whether the public convenience and necessity require the
operation of any taxicab business, the Mayor shall consider the number of
taxicabs operating in the City at the date of such application for the license
required in Section 870.03 and shall, in the issuance of such license, consider
whether the demands of the public require the additional taxicab service, the
financial responsibility of the applicant, the number, kind and type of
equipment to be used, and whether the additional taxicab service will result in
such congestion of traffic in the streets and at the taxicab stands in the City
as will constitute a demoralization of the taxicab business and be conducive to
a greater public hazard. The judgment of the Mayor on the operation of
convenience and necessity, as well as the qualifications of the applicant,
shall be final and conclusive.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.08   TRANSFERABILITY OF TAXICAB OPERATOR'S LICENSE.
   No taxicab operator's license issued hereunder shall be permitted to be
transferred from one owner to another by the Mayor, except after a finding of
public convenience and necessity by him. Such finding shall be arrived at in
the same manner as in the case of an original application. The applicant for
the transfer of a license shall file with his application the consent in
writing of the former owner of such license and shall comply with all the
provisions and conditions of this chapter covering taxicabs.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.09   INCREASE IN NUMBER OF CABS.
   No taxicab operator shall increase the number of taxicabs operated by it
without first having obtained the approval of the Mayor or other duly
authorized issuing authority, upon a showing of public necessity and
convenience therefor in similar manner and with like procedure as for the
issuance of an original taxicab operator's license, as provided in this
chapter.
   870.10   ANNUAL REVIEW.
   At the time of the issuance of the taxicab operator's license and annually
thereafter, on or before January 1 of each calendar year, no taxicab operator
operating in the City shall fail to pay to the Mayor or other duly authorized
issuing authority the fees as provided hereinafter for each original and
additional taxicab to be operated by it on the following basis:
   (a)   If put into operation between January 1 and June 30 of any year, for
the balance of the calendar year, the sum of ten dollars ($10.00) per year; and
   (b)   If put into operation between July 1 and December 1 of any year, for
the balance of the calendar year, the sum of seven dollars and fifty cents
($7.50).
   Nothing in this section shall be construed to mean that there shall be a
refund of any part or portion of any license fee so paid in case any taxicab is
taken off the streets and not thereafter operated by such operator during the
time for which a license has been issued.
   870.11   INFORMATION TO BE FILED.
   No taxicab operator's license shall be issued, nor shall any taxicab be
operated upon the streets of the City until the taxicab operator has filed with
the Mayor or other duly authorized issuing authority a statement showing:
   (a)   The make of motor car to be used;
   (b)   The State license number of each car;
   (c)   The factory number of the same;
   (d)   The name of the owner of the car;
   (e)   The seating capacity as provided for by the manufacturer; and
   (f)   The name of the drivers to be in charge of the operation of the cars
and their places of residence.
   870.12   INSURANCE REQUIRED.
   The statement referred to in Section 870.11 shall be accompanied by a policy
of liability insurance for each taxicab. Such policy shall be acceptable to and
approved by the Mayor, and shall be written by an insurance company authorized
to carry on business and write such policies in the State. Such policy shall
indemnify such taxicab operator in the sum of at least one hundred thousand
dollars ($100, 000) for injury to one person, three hundred thousand dollars
($300, 000) for injury to more than one person and ten thousand dollars ($10,
000) property damage in any one accident from the operation of the taxicab of
such operator. The policy shall further contain a clause obligating the insurer
to give ten days' written notice to the Mayor before cancellation of or
expiration of such policy. Such license shall expire upon the lapse or
termination of the policy. Such policy shall also contain a provision for the
continuing liability thereunder for the full amount, notwithstanding any
recovery thereon. If at any time in the judgment of the Mayor, such policy is
not sufficient for any cause, the Mayor may require the operator of such
taxicab to replace the policy of insurance with another approved by the Mayor.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.13   IDENTIFICATION.
   (a)   Every person owning and operating a taxicab under license from the
City may adopt any trade name, design, color scheme or method of painting or
lettering such taxicab that is approved by the Mayor. Such trade name, design,
color scheme or method of painting or lettering shall include the following
matter:
      (1)   A serial body number, assigned by the Mayor to such taxicab, and
painted on each side and on the rear of the taxicab; and
      (2)   The name of the owner or the trade name under which he does
business, painted on each side and on the rear of the taxicab. Whenever the
name of the owner or such trade name does not include any one of the words
"taxicab," "taxi" or "cab," then the word "taxicab" shall be painted on each
side of the taxicab immediately beneath such name or trade name.
   (b)   All mandatory lettering and wording, whether in a particular trade
name, design color scheme, method of painting or lettering, or otherwise, shall
be of such color as in the opinion of the Mayor will contrast distinctly with
the color of the body of the taxicab. The serial body numbers on sides and rear
shall be no less than four inches in height.
   (c)   Whenever the word "paint" or "painted" is used in this chapter, it
shall mean the application of coloring matter in oil solution, not in water
solution.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.14   CARRYING CAPACITY.
No taxicab shall carry more than five adult passengers, including the driver.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.15   TAXICAB DRIVER'S LICENSE REQUIRED; FEE; EFFECTIVE PERIOD.
   No person shall operate a taxicab in the City without first having obtained
a taxicab driver's license from the Chief of Police. The fee for such license
shall be ten dollars ($10.00) for each year, such fee to be collected by the
Chief. All such licenses shall expire on December 31 of each year.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.16   TAXICAB DRIVER'S LICENSE APPLICATION.
   (a)   The application for a taxicab driver's license shall be made in
writing by the applicant upon blank forms to be furnished by the Chief of
Police. The applicant shall fill out a blank form to be provided by the Chief,
giving his full name, residence, places of residence for five years next
preceding the date of such application, age, height, color of eyes and hair,
place of birth, whether a citizen of the United States, places of previous
employment, whether married or single, whether he has ever been convicted of a
felony or misdemeanor and if so when and where and how many times, and whether
he has previously been licensed as a driver and if so whether his license has
ever been revoked and for what cause. The application shall be accompanied by
two unmounted, unretouched photographs of the applicant taken within 100 days
of the date of the application and which shall not be less than two by three
inches in size and suitable for attachment to such license. If such license is
issued to such applicant, one photograph shall be securely attached to the
license issued to such person and the other shall be filed with the application
in the office of the Chief. Each licensed driver shall at all times display
such license and photograph in his taxicab so that any passenger occupying the
taxicab may inspect the same, and upon demand of any police officer, he shall
exhibit the same to him. When the application for a license is denied, one copy
of the photograph shall be returned to the applicant and the other kept in the
files of the office of the Chief.
   (b)   The application shall be signed and sworn to by the applicant and
filed as a permanent record in the office of the Chief. No applicant shall make
any false statement or representation for the purpose of securing a license.
Any such false statement or representation shall, in addition to subjecting the
applicant to the penalty provided in Section 870.99, forthwith, upon its
discovery, work a revocation of such license.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.17   EXAMINATION.
   Each applicant for a taxicab driver's license shall be examined by the Chief
of Police as to his knowledge of the laws, rules and regulations governing
vehicular traffic upon the public streets of the City and upon his knowledge of
the manner and method of driving and operating a motor vehicle. The fee for
such examination shall be ten dollars ($10.00).
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.18   LIMITATIONS ON ISSUANCE.
   No person shall be issued a taxicab driver's license unless such person:
   (a)   Is eighteen years of age or over, a citizen of the United States and
of good moral character;
   (b)   Is of sound physique, with good eyesight, and no bodily or mental
infirmities which render him unfit for the safe operation of a motor vehicle;
   (c)   Is clean in dress and person and not addicted to the use of
intoxicating liquors or drugs; and
   (d)   Undergoes an annual physical examination by a licensed doctor and
supplies the Police Chief with a copy of the examination report.
   870.19   GROUNDS FOR DENIAL.
   (a)   A taxicab driver's license may be denied to any applicant who, within
ten years prior to the application, has been convicted of an offense under
Federal, state or local law, whether charged under such statutes or a local
ordinance.
   (b)   The license shall be denied in the event of a conviction of the
applicant within such period of any offense involving gambling, illegal traffic
in intoxicating liquor or in narcotics or against public morals herein.
   870.20   LICENSE ISSUANCE; RENEWAL.
   (a)   Upon satisfactory fulfillment of the requirements of this chapter and
satisfactory examination having been passed, the Chief of Police shall, upon
payment of the required fee, issue to the applicant a taxicab driver's license.
   (b)   The Chief of Police may renew taxicab drivers' licenses from year to
year upon payment of the required fee without requiring anew the information
provided for in Section 870.16, but new photographs may be required when and as
often as necessary. A driver in applying for a renewal of his license shall
make application not less than thirty days next preceding its expiration, upon
a form to be furnished by the Chief, entitled "application for renewal of
taxicab driver's license, " which shall be filled out with the name and address
of the applicant, together with a statement of the date upon which his original
license was granted, the number thereof and such other information as the Chief
may require.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.21   NOTIFICATION OF CHANGE OF ADDRESS.
   No person who has been issued a taxicab driver's license shall fail to
notify the Chief of Police of any change in his address and at all times keep
on file in the office of the Chief his correct address.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.22   DEFACING, REMOVING OR OBLITERATING LICENSE.
   Any person who has been issued a taxicab driver's license, who defaces,
removes or obliterates any official entry made upon his license, shall be
punished by a revocation of his license.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.23   REVOCATION OR SUSPENSION OF TAXICAB DRIVER'S LICENSE.
   Any taxicab driver's license may be suspended or revoked at any time by the
Mayor for the violation of any of the provisions of this chapter or any other
ordinance of the City, law of the State or of the United States, and the Chief
of Police and all police officers shall call the attention of the Mayor to any
such violation on the part of the licensee. Any such suspension or revocation
shall be noted on the license, together with a statement of the reason
therefor. No driver whose license has been revoked shall again be licensed and
nothing contained in this section shall be construed so as to require the
license fee to be refunded.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.24   FARE SCHEDULE AND MAP; POSTING AND RECEIPTS.
   (a)   A current schedule of fares shall at all times be maintained in the
office of the Mayor, which shall be equal to or lower than the schedules of
surrounding cities. The Fare Zone Map, which is attached to the copy of
original Ordinance 72-93, passed February 13, 1973, and is on file in the
office of the Administrative Assistant, is made a part hereof, and no fare
shall be charged or collected in excess of the amounts shown thereon.
   (b)   The rates of fare charged by the driver of any taxicab shall be posted
in a conspicuous place in the taxicab, printed in a type not smaller than one-
half inch, and shall also be painted on each side of the cab in letters not
less than four inches in height. No owner, driver or person in charge or
control of a taxicab shall fail to deliver to the person paying for such fare,
a receipt therefor, which receipt shall show the amount of fare paid, the point
where such person was accepted as a passenger and where discharged, the number
of passengers, the number of the cab and the name of the company operating the
cab.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.25   TAXICAB STANDS.
   (a)   The Chief of Police shall fix the number of taxicabs permitted to
occupy each taxicab stand and shall limit the number of vehicles that any
taxicab operator may have parked at any stand at any time.
   (b)   Only taxicabs in such number as are designated and fixed by the Chief
shall remain at the stand while waiting for employment, and only in a single
file, pointed in accordance with the provisions of Part Four - the Traffic
Code.
   (c)   No operator of a taxicab standing at the head of any such line shall
refuse to carry any orderly person applying for a taxicab, who agrees to pay
the proper rate of fare, but this shall not prevent any person from selecting
any taxicab he may desire on such stand, whether it is at the head of the line
or not. As the taxicabs leave the line with passengers, those behind shall move
up and any taxicab seeking a space on the stand shall approach the same only
from the rear of the stand and shall stop as near as possible to the last cab
already in line.
   (d)   No operator of a taxicab shall stand at any place on the streets of
the City for the purpose of soliciting business, except upon public stands as
established and fixed by Council or other duly authorized person, and no person
shall solicit for taxicabs, except the driver of a taxicab while sitting upon
the driver's seat of his vehicle, and such driver shall remain in the driver's
seat of his vehicle, except when assisting passengers in or out of such
vehicle.
   (e)   No operator of a vehicle, other than a licensed taxicab, shall stop in
a public stand, except while receiving or discharging passengers.
   870.26   PROHIBITED ACTS OF TAXICAB DRIVERS.
   No operator of a taxicab shall do any of the following:
   (a)   Drive a taxicab while under the influence of intoxicating liquor or
drink any intoxicating liquor whatsoever while transporting passengers; (b)
Allow any taxicab to be used for immoral purposes;
   (c)   Charge more than the rates established in this chapter;
   (d)   Fail, neglect or refuse to turn in to the Chief of Police within
twenty-four hours all lost articles found in his taxicab;
   (e)   Drive or operate a taxicab upon any street of the City unless the
owner thereof is operating under and pursuant to a taxicab operator's license,
as provided for in this chapter;
   (f)   Use any portion of the public streets or alleys as a taxicab stand or
permit a taxicab in his charge to stand upon any portion of the public streets
or alleys, except for such times as are necessary to load or unload passengers,
except in such portion of the public streets and alleys as have been set apart
by Council as taxicab stands and allotted to the particular taxicab in
question;
   (g)   Fail to notify the Chief of Police within twelve hours after an
accident, giving the time and location of the accident, the name of any person
injured, the condition of such injured person and the character of injury as
far as known, and in case of property damage, a description of the property and
the estimated amount of such damage;
   (h)   Travel up and down the highways seeking customers, commonly called
cruising;"
   (i)    Receive and discharge passengers from the taxicab from any place
other than the side thereof nearest the right-hand side of the road,
passengers' driveways, shopping center parking lot or other public or private
parking lots in any section of the City;
   (j)   Permit passengers to enter or leave, except at the side thereof
nearest the curb, at the right-hand side thereof;
   (k)   Exceed the seating capacity of the taxicab as shown by the application
filed with the Mayor or other duly authorized issuing authority;
   (l)   Drive a taxicab during the period from one-half hour after sunset to
one-half hour before sunrise, unless the exterior thereof is effectively
illuminated; or
   (m)   Deceive or attempt to deceive any passenger, prospective passenger or
other person by any misrepresentations as to the number, ownership or other
identity of his taxicab, or coerce any person for the purpose of securing or
attempting to secure him as a passenger in such taxicab, or solicit patronage
while at a taxicab stand except while seated on the driver's seat of his
taxicab, or solicit patronage by loud, boisterous outcry.
   870.27   RECORDS OF TAXICAB DRIVERS' LICENSES; FORMS.
   The Mayor shall file and keep a complete record of all taxicab drivers'
license applications, fees paid, and licenses issued, with the name and address
of each licensee and the name and business address of his employer. The license
shall be in such form as the Mayor shall prescribe.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.28   TRIP RECORD TO BE MAINTAINED.
   No operator of a taxicab business shall fail to keep on file in the office
thereof a call sheet or trip record containing a complete record of the daily
operation of each licensed taxicab of the operator, and to make such record
immediately available to and submit the same for inspection by the Police
Department upon request. Such record shall be kept for a period of at least one
year.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73. )
   870.29   TAXIS TO BE KEPT IN CLEAN AND SANITARY CONDITION.
   Every taxicab operated under this chapter shall at all times be kept in a
clean and sanitary condition. The violation of this section, after reasonable
notice to the operator and an opportunity duly afforded to comply therewith,
shall be grounds for revocation of the taxicab operator's license.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.30   INSPECTION OF TAXICABS.
   The Police Department shall, from time to time as it deems necessary or
convenient, cause to be made an inspection of all licensed taxicabs. If any
taxicab is found unsafe or unfit for the transportation of public passengers,
or in an unclean or unsanitary condition, notice shall be given to the holder
of the taxicab operator's license therefor, and no person shall operate such
taxicab in service until the same has been put in a safe and fit condition and
reinspected and approved for use in service.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.31   ROOF LIGHTS.
   All vehicles used as taxicabs in the City shall display white roof lights
with the insignia "Taxi" inscribed on the same in black, designating such
vehicle as a taxicab.
(Ord.72-93. Passed 2-13-73.)
   870.32   REVOCATION OF TAXICAB OPERATOR'S LICENSE.
   (a)   Whenever the Mayor deems it conducive to the public peace, health,
safety, convenience and general welfare, and after notice and hearing as set
forth in this chapter for the granting of an application for a taxicab
operator's license, the Mayor may revoke any taxicab operator's license
granted, or modify or alter the same.
   (b)   Any taxicab operator aggrieved by a finding of the Mayor may appeal to
Council in writing within ten days of such finding.
   870.99   PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section 804.99 for general Code penalty if no specific
penalty is provided.)
CHAPTER 874
Trap Shooting
874.01   License fee.

874.99   Penalty.
   CROSS REFERENCES

   Menacing - see GEN. OFF. 636.04, 636.05
   Criminal damaging or endangering - see GEN. OFF. 642.10

   Disorderly conduct - see GEN. OFF. 648.04
   Littering - see GEN. OFF. 660.03
